parameters.name: LoRaWAN
parameters.description: The gateway configuration information to use to create the wireless gateway. GatewayEui (string) --- The gateway's EUI value. RfRegion (string) --- The frequency band (RFRegion) value. JoinEuiFilters (list) --- A list of JoinEuiRange used by LoRa gateways to filter LoRa frames. (list) --- A pair of join EUI describing a range [BegEui, EndEui], both ends are inclusive. (string) --- NetIdFilters (list) --- A list of NetId values that are used by LoRa gateways to filter the uplink frames. (string) --- LoRaWAN network ID. SubBands (list) --- A list of integer indicating which sub bands are supported by LoRa gateway. (integer) --- A subset of supported frequency channels in a certain RFRegion. Beaconing (dict) --- Beaconing object information, which consists of the data rate and frequency parameters. DataRate (integer) --- The data rate for gateways that are sending the beacons. Frequencies (list) --- The frequency list for the gateways to send the beacons. (integer) --- MaxEirp (float) --- The MaxEIRP value.

nested_params.name: JoinEuiFilters
nested_params.description: A list of JoinEuiRange used by LoRa gateways to filter LoRa frames.

nested_params.name: NetIdFilters
nested_params.description: A list of NetId values that are used by LoRa gateways to filter the uplink frames.

nested_params.name: SubBands
nested_params.description: A list of integer indicating which sub bands are supported by LoRa gateway.

nested_params.name: Beaconing
nested_params.description: Beaconing object information, which consists of the data rate and frequency parameters.

nested_params.name: DataRate
nested_params.description: The data rate for gateways that are sending the beacons.

nested_params.name: Frequencies
nested_params.description: The frequency list for the gateways to send the beacons.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to attach to the new wireless gateway. Tags are metadata that you can use to manage a resource. (dict) --- A simple label consisting of a customer-defined key-value pair The tag's key value. The tag's value.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: Each resource must have a unique client request token. The client token is used to implement idempotency. It ensures that the request completes no more than one time. If you retry a request with the same token and the same parameters, the request will complete successfully. However, if you try to create a new resource using the same token but different parameters, an HTTP 409 conflict occurs. If you omit this value, AWS SDKs will automatically generate a unique client request. For more information about idempotency, see Ensuring idempotency in Amazon EC2 API requests. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name of the new resource.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of the new wireless gateway.
